intro: Paratropia confinis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved paratropia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The species is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
